thread.title: Breitbart editor loses book deal over pedophilia controversy | New York Post
thread.title_full: Breitbart editor loses book deal over pedophilia controversy | New York Post

author: Daniel Halper
title: Breitbart editor loses book deal over pedophilia controversy | New York Post
text:
Breitbart tech editor Milo Yiannopoulos will not speak at the... 
Milo Yiannopoulos is too “Dangerous” for Simon & Schuster. 
The free speech advocate’s book has been canceled by the publishing giant “after careful consideration,” it was announced Monday. 
The news comes the same day Yiannopoulos’ scheduled speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference in Maryland on Friday was canned after it was revealed he appeared to make comments condoning pedophilia. 
The book was tentatively titled “Dangerous” and had been acquired for a reported $250,000. 
It had been scheduled to be published by Threshold Editions, a conservative imprint of Simon & Schuster, in June.
